wikipedia_page.main: William Scott (born 23 March 1886, date of death unknown) was an English long-distance runner who competed at the 1912 Summer Olympics. He reached the finals of individual 10,000 m and cross-country races, but failed to complete them, partly due to a strong heat.Scott won the Amateur Athletic Association title over 10 miles in 1911 and 1912, and finished second in the national cross-country championship in 1911. He competed for England in the International Cross Country Championships in 1910–13.

William Scott (born 8 February 1952) is an Australian long-distance runner. He competed in the men's 10,000 metres at the 1980 Summer Olympics.
